primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The apocalyptic arrival of God as Judge who, instead of condemning the guilty, bears the judgment Himself to ransom the captives.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge of all the universe steps on the scene.
The Son of God has borne it all himself.
He still has the mark of the nails... Source of endless jubilation to his ransomed worshippers.

object.identificatie: The salvation/ransoming of humanity and the restoration of the Kingdom.
tekstueel_bewijs: To save us all from Satan’s power when we were gone astray.
He brought us over into righteousness and life.

zender.identificatie: The Divine Purpose / The Triune God
tekstueel_bewijs: Called forth by the divine purpose to declare the apocalyptic arrival of God.
These people are you and me. All of us sinners.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver/Beneficiary who is initially the Opponent (sinner).

helper.identificatie: John the Baptist / The Holy Spirit (implied in refinement)
tekstueel_bewijs: John is the singular figure who stands at the juncture of the ages.
Even now he is reeds beginning to refine us.
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes an internal refining fire.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Satan, and the 'Secret Hearts' of men.
tekstueel_bewijs: To save us all from Satan’s power.
We were slaves to sin and death.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'Satan's power' and 'Death'—forces humanity cannot overcome alone.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical refinement of the believer into the image of Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God (as Refiner)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A purified people presenting right offerings.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The refinement (sanctification) is a consequence of the Judge bearing the judgment (justification).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Divine Purpose → Salvation/Ransom → Sinners (You and Me)

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Son of God has borne it all himself.
He will not allow us to remain as we are.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We set him at naught constantly.
We sell him for our own pleasure.
We rattle that off every Sunday.

voorbeelden: Something has to be done to us.
We don’t want our hearts to be exposed.
If we stop to think about it, it’s pretty scary.
Who can stand when he appears?
He brought us over into righteousness.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the human lack of power (inability to stand) and the divine endowment of power (Christ's victory and refining work).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S2 (Hidden secrets) to S2 (The reality of Judgment) to S1 (Grace through the Judge's wounds).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Subject-Switch': The Judge (S1) takes the place of the judged (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; judgment is described as 'dreadful' and 'burning lye soap'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it places a heavy demand on the hearer to face judgment, the 'doing' is entirely transferred to Christ.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in John the Baptist
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: John the Baptist is the central personage... the first person to belong to the arriving age.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge who is to come has given himself to be judged in our place.
Something has to be done to us; we have to be purified.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: John the Baptist is treated as a herald and a signpost of the new age, not a moral hero to be imitated by human effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them as instruments of God's apocalyptic action.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from terror/guilt to 'blazing, ecstatic joy'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by faith alone; the hearer is the object of God's mercy.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'dreadful' law to the 'compassionate' gospel is seamless and structurally sound.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Jesus accepts you as you are' and 'He will not allow us to remain as we are'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Judge... has given himself to be judged in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (as refining fire) provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that the human lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is what 'nailed him to the tree' and requires a 'complete overhaul'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject of all redemptive verbs.

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The 'Wailing Sinner' who becomes the 'Ransomed Worshipper'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current movement from Law to Gospel.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Devoir (Law) in the first half, but corrected by Pouvoir (Grace) in the second.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The current balance is homiletically effective for Advent.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's death) strictly precedes and enables Ethics (Refinement).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented preaching that does not shy away from the severity of the Law.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the Coventry Carol and Johnny Cash as 'pathos', Greimasian analysis reveals these are 'Helpers' in the narrative program of exposing the 'Opponent' (Sin).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical context of Malachi; this analysis shows how Malachi functions as a 'Sender' of values in the sermon's deep structure.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Subject-Switch' where the Judge becomes the Judged, which is the semiotic engine of the sermon's power.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the hymn 'Lo, He Comes with Clouds Descending' as a secondary narrative structure that mirrors the primary sermon movement.
